GeneralRouteNotes: • Find the best times to travel by clicking here.
SeasonalRouteNotes:
• Reservations are recommended for all vehicles on this route.
  • This route has a new schedule for Summer 2025. See the project page for details on the process.
  • The Anacortes-San Juan Islands route will operate a regular Friday schedule on Independence Day, and a Sunday schedule on Labor Day.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Ana/SJs, PT/Coup - Fall Vehicle Reservations Release Postponed
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Ana/SJs, PT/Coup - Fall Vehicle Reservations Release Postponed
Alerts.AlertFullText: We’re postponing our two-month vehicle reservations release for our fall sailing season (Sept. 21 to Dec. 27). The delay is needed while we work on updates to our reservation system. We plan to share the new release date on Tuesday, July 22.

Alerts.AlertDescription: All Routes - Plan ahead: Major I-5 Closures Could Affect Travel to/from Ferry Terminals
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Plan ahead: Major I-5 Closures Could Affect Travel to/from Ferry Terminals
Alerts.AlertFullText:
If your ferry plans include travel on I-5 through Seattle, prepare for major delays. Beginning this weekend, roadwork for the Revive I-5 project will cause closures and lane reductions.  

  • 11:59 p.m. Friday, July 18 to 5 a.m. Monday, July 21: All northbound lanes of I-5 will be closed from I-90 to Northeast 45th Street. 
  • July 21 to Aug. 15: Northbound I-5 over the Ship Canal Bridge will be reduced to two lanes, around the clock. 
  • Night of Aug. 15 to the morning of Aug. 18: Another full northbound weekend closure planned. 

The I-5 express lanes will run northbound 24/7 for the duration of this work. While the work is happening in the northbound lanes, southbound I-5 travelers should also expect delays. 

If your planned travel to or from a ferry terminal takes you on I-5 through Seattle: 

  • Allow extra travel time to reach terminals or your final destination 
  • Plan ahead and check traffic conditions before leaving 
  • Use alternate routes when possible 
  • Consider transit or rideshare to avoid delays 
  • Consider adjusting when you travel 

For detour maps and more details, visit the Revive I-5 project page.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Sea/BI-Wenatchee Returns to Service This Afternoon--7/18
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Wenatchee Returns to Service This Afternoon--7/18
Alerts.AlertFullText:
The Wenatchee returns to service this afternoon as our first and North America’s largest hybrid-electric ferry! The first sailing with customers will be the 2:05 p.m. Bainbridge to Seattle sailing today. The Wenatchee will run part-time in the evenings on the Seattle/Bainbridge route, before returning to full-time service in the next few weeks.  

We can’t wait to welcome passengers aboard Wenatchee again! Learn more about the Wenatchee’s hybrid-electric conversion in our blog post.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Ana/SJs - Tillikum Returning as Interisland Vessel
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Ana/SJs - Tillikum Returning as Interisland Vessel
Alerts.AlertFullText: After successful maintenance, repairs, and inspections, the Tillikum will return to the Anacortes/San Juan Islands route tonight, Friday, July 18. The Tillikum will replace the Sealth as the interisland vessel, starting with the 11:15 p.m. Anacortes to Friday Harbor sailing. Thank you for your patience as we maintain, repair, and inspect our vessels.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Plan Ahead:  Vashon Island Strawberry Festival
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Plan Ahead:  Vashon Island Strawberry Festival
Alerts.AlertFullText:
Our Vashon Island ferries will be very busy this weekend. The community’s annual Strawberry Festival is happening, and it brings thousands of visitors to the island.  

If you’re heading to the Strawberry Festival, we recommend walking on at our Fauntleroy, Southworth or Point Defiance terminals, if possible. King County Metro’s Route 118 and 119 serves the dock at both Vashon and Tahlequah and stops at the festival.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Ana/SJs-ADA Alert: The Elevator on the Sealth is Unavailable
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Ana/SJs-ADA Alert: The Elevator on the Sealth is Unavailable
Alerts.AlertFullText: The elevator on the Sealth is temporarily unavailable.  A portable restroom is available on the car deck level.  Updates will occur when more information is available.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Edm/King - Edmonds Terminal Status - Two Hour Wait for Drivers
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Edm/King - Edmonds Terminal Status - Two Hour Wait for Drivers
Alerts.AlertFullText:
There is a two hour wait for drivers departing the Edmonds terminal. 

We will continue to send updated travel information as it becomes available. Customers can check the online schedule for more information on scheduled upcoming sailings and also view the real-time travel map for live boat location information.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Edm/King - Kingston Terminal Construction Through July 2026
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Edm/King - Kingston Terminal Construction Through July 2026
Alerts.AlertFullText:
On Monday, June 16, 2025 we began construction at the Kingston Ferry Terminal through July 2026. This work is part of a seismic retrofit project at the terminal. Ferry service will operate as normal, with one sailing delayed by the construction.  We appreciate your patience as we work to improve the Kingston terminal.  

Delayed sailing: The 5:30 a.m. sailing from Kingston to Edmonds will be delayed up to 10 minutes during construction. This delay is due to needing to move a vessel from its overnight tie-up location to where we board passengers in Kingston. We will depart on time whenever possible. Please continue to arrive for a 5:30 a.m. sailing, for the days we can leave on time.  

Impacts to bus connections until August 30: The delayed sailing will cause a missed connection to Community Transit Route 909, which departs Edmonds Station at 6:10 a.m. on weekdays. Please see the Route 909 schedule for alternate bus times. Community Transit Route 130 is another bus option and departs Edmonds Station at 6:27 a.m. on weekdays. Starting August 30, the Community Transit Route 909 will have a service change to align with the delayed 5:30 a.m. sailing.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Faunt/Va/SW - Three-Boat Service Started Monday, June 30
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Faunt/Va/SW - Three-Boat Service Started Monday, June 30
Alerts.AlertFullText:
Three-boat service starts on Monday, June 30 

On Monday, June 30, the Fauntleroy/Vashon/Southworth “Triangle” route returned to full three-boat service daily for the first time since October 2021. 

Three-boat schedules starting on June 30 

  • Fauntleroy/Vashon 
  • Fauntleroy/Southworth 
  • Southworth/Vashon 

If there are service disruptions, the route may shift back to two-boat service. Thanks to feedback from a community working group, we have a new, updated two-boat schedule. More information on these unplanned service disruptions can be found in our Service Contingency Plan. 

We will continue to send updated travel information as it becomes available. Customers can check the online schedule for more information on scheduled upcoming sailings and also view the real-time travel map for live boat location information.

Alerts.AlertDescription: PT/Coup - Reservation Status for 7/18. Full Until 910p from Coup and Full Remainder of Day from PT
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: PT/Coup - Port Townsend/Coupeville Reservation Status for 7/18
Alerts.AlertFullText:
For Friday, July 18, vehicle reservations are full from Coupeville until 9:10 p.m. and from Port Townsend for the remainder of the service day.

General standby space is very limited and will be loaded on a first come, first serve basis. 

Alternate routes are highly advised using either Edmonds/Kingston and/or Mukilteo/Clinton.

Mukilteo / Clinton Schedule 

Edmonds / Kingston Schedule

Alerts.AlertDescription: PT/Coup - Two-Boat Service Started Friday, July 4
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: PT/Coup - Two-Boat Service Started Friday, July 4
Alerts.AlertFullText:
A second vessel will now sail on the Port Townsend/Coupeville route every Friday through Monday beginning July 4. The two-boat schedule will continue through the route’s busy season, ending October 13.

This added service is part of our broader plan to restore more ferry service this summer. 
 
The two-boat sailing schedule is available on our website. Even with two boats on the route, vehicle reservations are still strongly recommended. Make a reservation now.

Alerts.AlertFullText:
Our Vashon Island ferries will be very busy this weekend. The community’s annual Strawberry Festival is happening, and it brings thousands of visitors to the island.  

If you’re heading to the Strawberry Festival, we recommend walking on at our Fauntleroy, Southworth or Point Defiance terminals, if possible. King County Metro’s Route 118 and 119 serves the dock at both Vashon and Tahlequah and stops at the festival.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Sea/BI - Seattle Terminal Status - One Hour Wait For Drivers From Seattle to BI
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Sea/BI - Seattle Terminal Status - One Hour Wait For Drivers From Seattle to BI
Alerts.AlertFullText:
There is an estimated one hour wait for drivers departing Seattle for Bainbridge. 

We will continue to send updated travel information as it becomes available. Customers can check the online schedule for more information on scheduled upcoming sailings and also view the real-time travel map for live boat location information.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Sea/BI - Both Vessels Running an Estimated 20-25 Mins Behind Schedule. See the Real-Time Map.
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Sea/BI - Both Vessels Running an Estimated 20-25 Mins Behind Schedule
Alerts.AlertFullText:
The #1 Puyallup is running an estimated 25 minutes behind schedule.

The #2 Wenatchee is running an estimated 20 minutes behind schedule.

We will continue to send updated travel information as it becomes available. Customers can check the online schedule for more information on scheduled upcoming sailings and also view the real-time travel map for live boat location information.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Sea/BI - Update - Sunday Morning Sailing No Longer Cancelled
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Sea/BI - Update - Sunday Morning Sailing No Longer Cancelled
Alerts.AlertFullText: The ongoing delays at the fuel dock have been resolved. The 8:55 a.m. Seattle to Bainbridge sailing this Sunday is no longer cancelled and will sail as scheduled.

GeneralRouteNotes: • Find the best times to travel by clicking here.

Alerts.AlertDescription: All Routes - Plan ahead: Major I-5 Closures Could Affect Travel to/from Ferry Terminals
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Plan ahead: Major I-5 Closures Could Affect Travel to/from Ferry Terminals
Alerts.AlertFullText:
If your ferry plans include travel on I-5 through Seattle, prepare for major delays. Beginning this weekend, roadwork for the Revive I-5 project will cause closures and lane reductions.  

  • 11:59 p.m. Friday, July 18 to 5 a.m. Monday, July 21: All northbound lanes of I-5 will be closed from I-90 to Northeast 45th Street. 
  • July 21 to Aug. 15: Northbound I-5 over the Ship Canal Bridge will be reduced to two lanes, around the clock. 
  • Night of Aug. 15 to the morning of Aug. 18: Another full northbound weekend closure planned. 

The I-5 express lanes will run northbound 24/7 for the duration of this work. While the work is happening in the northbound lanes, southbound I-5 travelers should also expect delays. 

If your planned travel to or from a ferry terminal takes you on I-5 through Seattle: 

  • Allow extra travel time to reach terminals or your final destination 
  • Plan ahead and check traffic conditions before leaving 
  • Use alternate routes when possible 
  • Consider transit or rideshare to avoid delays 
  • Consider adjusting when you travel 

For detour maps and more details, visit the Revive I-5 project page.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Sea/BI-Wenatchee Returns to Service This Afternoon--7/18
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Wenatchee Returns to Service This Afternoon--7/18
Alerts.AlertFullText:
The Wenatchee returns to service this afternoon as our first and North America’s largest hybrid-electric ferry! The first sailing with customers will be the 2:05 p.m. Bainbridge to Seattle sailing today. The Wenatchee will run part-time in the evenings on the Seattle/Bainbridge route, before returning to full-time service in the next few weeks.  

We can’t wait to welcome passengers aboard Wenatchee again! Learn more about the Wenatchee’s hybrid-electric conversion in our blog post.

Alerts.AlertDescription: Faunt/Va/SW - Three-Boat Service Started Monday, June 30
Alerts.AlertFullTitle: Faunt/Va/SW - Three-Boat Service Started Monday, June 30
Alerts.AlertFullText:
Three-boat service starts on Monday, June 30 

On Monday, June 30, the Fauntleroy/Vashon/Southworth “Triangle” route returned to full three-boat service daily for the first time since October 2021. 

Three-boat schedules starting on June 30 

  • Fauntleroy/Vashon 
  • Fauntleroy/Southworth 
  • Southworth/Vashon 

If there are service disruptions, the route may shift back to two-boat service. Thanks to feedback from a community working group, we have a new, updated two-boat schedule. More information on these unplanned service disruptions can be found in our Service Contingency Plan. 

We will continue to send updated travel information as it becomes available. Customers can check the online schedule for more information on scheduled upcoming sailings and also view the real-time travel map for live boat location information.
